# XML Test Variations

This directory contains various XML representations of the same User data structure. All these files are semantically equivalent but use different namespace declaration strategies.

## Namespace URLs

- Default/User: `http://example.com/schema/user`
- Profile (ns1): `http://example.com/schema/profile`
- Address (ns2): `http://example.com/schema/address`

## Test Files

### Generated Reference

- **00_generated.xml** - Generated by Go's standard xml.Marshal with `ns1:` colon syntax in tags

### Pure Variations

- **01_explicit_prefixes.xml** - Uses explicit `ns1:` and `ns2:` prefixes throughout
- **02_different_prefix_names.xml** - Uses `prf:` and `addr:` instead of `ns1:` and `ns2:`
- **03_profile_as_default.xml** - Profile namespace is default, user uses `usr:` prefix
- **04_address_as_default.xml** - Address namespace is default, uses `u:` for user, `p:` for profile
- **05_single_char_prefixes.xml** - Uses single-character prefixes `x:` and `y:`
- **06_nested_declarations.xml** - Declares namespaces on nested elements instead of root

### Mixed Variations

- **07_ns1_root_ns2_nested.xml** - ns1 declared at root, ns2 declared on nested address/metadata elements
- **08_ns2_root_ns1_nested.xml** - ns2 declared at root, ns1 declared on nested profile/settings elements
- **09_default_namespace_switch.xml** - Switches default namespace on profile/settings, uses ns2: prefix for address
- **10_prefix_redeclaration.xml** - Mixes different prefix names (ns1, prf, addr, ns2) at different levels
- **11_complex_combination.xml** - Complex mix of explicit prefixes, default namespace switching, and nested declarations

### Advanced Namespace Scenarios

- **12_multiple_prefixes_same_namespace.xml** - Multiple prefixes (ns1 and profile) both pointing to the same namespace URI
- **13_complete_default_switching.xml** - Each section switches the default namespace to match its content
- **14_no_root_declarations.xml** - No namespace prefixes declared at root, all declared on nested elements
- **15_namespaced_attributes.xml** - Attributes have namespace prefixes (ns1:visibility, ns2:type, meta:id, etc.)
- **16_overlapping_scopes.xml** - Different prefix names at each level with redundant redeclarations to test scope handling
